verses.verse: Now <WG1161> a certain<WG5100> man was<WG2258> sick<WG770>, Lazarus<WG2976> of<WG575> Bethany<WG963>, of the village<WG2968> of Mary<WG3137> and<WG2532> her<WG846> sister<WG79> Martha<WG1537>.

And it was<WG2258> that Mary<WG3137> who<WG3588> anointed<WG218> the Lord<WG2962> with<WG2359> ointment<WG3464>, and<WG2532> wiped<WG1591> his<WG846> feet<WG4228> with<WG2359> her<WG846> hair<WG2359>, whose<WG3739> brother<WG80> Lazarus<WG2976> was sick<WG770>.
The sisters<WG79> therefore<WG3767> sent<WG649> unto<WG4314> him<WG846>, saying<WG3004>, Lord<WG2962>, behold<WG1492>, he whom<WG3739> thou lovest<WG5368> is sick<WG770>.

But when<WG1161> Jesus<WG2424> heard<WG191> it<WG2036>, he said, This<WG3778> sickness<WG769> is<WG2076> not<WG3756> unto<WG4314> death<WG2288>, but<WG235> for<WG5228> the glory<WG1391> of God<WG2316>, that<WG2443> the Son<WG5207> of God<WG2316> may be glorified<WG1392> thereby<WG846>.
Now <WG1161> Jesus<WG2424> loved<WG25> Martha<WG3136>, and<WG2532> her<WG846> sister<WG79>, and<WG2532> Lazarus<WG2976>.

When <WG5613> therefore<WG3767> he heard<WG191> that<WG3754> he was sick<WG770>, he abode<WG3306> at that<WG3754> time<WG3306> two<WG1417> days<WG2250> in<WG1722> the place where<WG5117> he was<WG3303>.
Then <WG1899> after<WG3326> this<WG5124> he<WG3004> saith to<WG3101> the disciples<WG3101>, Let us go<WG71> into<WG1519> Judaea<WG2449> again<WG3825>.

The disciples<WG3101> say<WG3004> unto him<WG846>, Rabbi<WG4461>, the Jews<WG2453> were but now<WG3568> seeking<WG2212> to stone<WG3034> thee<WG4571>; and<WG2532> goest thou<WG5217> thither<WG1563> again<WG3825>?

Jesus <WG2424> answered<WG611>, Are there<WG1526> not<WG3780> twelve<WG1427> hours<WG5610> in the day<WG2250>? If<WG1437> a man<WG5100> walk<WG4043> in<WG1722> the day<WG2250>, he stumbleth<WG4350> not<WG3756>, because<WG3754> he seeth<WG991> the light<WG5457> of<WG2889> this<WG5127> world<WG2889>.
But <WG1161> if<WG1437> a man<WG5100> walk<WG4043> in<WG1722> the night<WG3571>, he stumbleth<WG4350>, because<WG3754> the light<WG5457> is<WG2076> not<WG3756> in<WG1722> him<WG846>.

These things<WG5023> spake he<WG2036>: and<WG2532> after<WG3326> this<WG5124> he saith<WG3004> unto them<WG846>, Our<WG2257> friend<WG5384> Lazarus<WG2976> is fallen asleep<WG2837>; but<WG235> I go<WG4198>, that<WG2443> I may awake<WG1852> him<WG846> out of sleep<WG1852>.
The <WG846> disciples<WG3101> therefore<WG3767> said<WG2036> unto him<WG2962>, Lord, if<WG1487> he is fallen asleep<WG2837>, he will recover<WG4982>.

Now <WG1161> Jesus<WG2424> had spoken<WG2046> of<WG4012> his<WG846> death<WG2288>: but<WG1161> they<WG1565> thought<WG1380> that<WG3754> he spake<WG3004> of<WG4012> taking rest<WG2838> in sleep<WG5258>.
Then <WG5119> Jesus<WG2424> therefore said<WG2036> unto them<WG846> plainly<WG3954>, Lazarus<WG2976> is dead<WG3767>.

And <WG2532> I am glad<WG5463> for<WG1223> your sakes<WG5209> that<WG2443> I was<WG2252> not<WG3756> there<WG1563>, to the intent<WG3754> ye may believe<WG4100>; nevertheless<WG235> let us go<WG71> unto<WG4314> him<WG846>.

Thomas <WG2381> therefore<WG3767>, who is called<WG3004> Didymus<WG1324>, said<WG2036> unto his fellow-disciples<WG4827>, Let<WG71> us<WG2249> also<WG2532> go<WG71>, that<WG2443> we may die<WG599> with<WG3326> him<WG846>.
So when<WG3767> Jesus<WG2424> came<WG2064>, he<WG846> found that<WG2147> he had<WG2192> been in<WG1722> the tomb<WG3419> four<WG5064> days<WG2250> already<WG2235>.
Now <WG1161> Bethany<WG963> was<WG2258> nigh unto<WG1451> Jerusalem<WG2414>, about<WG5613> fifteen<WG1178> furlongs<WG4712> off<WG575>;

and <WG2532> many<WG4183> of<WG1537> the Jews<WG2453> had come<WG2064> to<WG4012> Martha<WG3136> and<WG2532> Mary<WG3137>, to<WG2443> console<WG3888> them<WG846> concerning<WG4012> their<WG846> brother<WG4314>.

Martha <WG3136> therefore<WG3767>, when<WG5613> she heard<WG191> that<WG3754> Jesus<WG2424> was coming<WG2064>, went and met<WG5221> him<WG846>: but<WG1161> Mary<WG3137> still sat<WG2516> in<WG1722> the house<WG3624>.
Martha <WG3136> therefore<WG3767> said<WG2036> unto<WG4314> Jesus<WG2424>, Lord<WG2962>, if<WG1487> thou hadst been<WG2258> here<WG5602>, my<WG3450> brother<WG80> had<WG2348> not<WG3756> died<WG302>.
And <WG235> even now<WG3568> I know<WG1492> that<WG3754>, whatsoever<WG3745> thou shalt ask<WG154> of God<WG2316>, God<WG2316> will give<WG1325> thee<WG302>.
Jesus <WG2424> saith<WG3004> unto her<WG846>, Thy<WG4675> brother<WG80> shall rise again<WG450>.
Martha <WG3136> saith<WG3004> unto him<WG846>, I know<WG1492> that<WG3754> he shall rise again<WG450> in<WG1722> the resurrection<WG386> at<WG1722> the last<WG2078> day<WG2250>.

Jesus <WG2424> said<WG2036> unto her<WG846>, I<WG1473> am<WG1510> the resurrection<WG386>, and<WG2532> the life<WG2222>: he that believeth<WG4100> on<WG1519> me<WG1691>, though<WG2579> he die<WG599>, yet<WG2579> shall he live<WG2198>;
and <WG2532> whosoever<WG3956> liveth<WG2198> and<WG2532> believeth<WG4100> on<WG1519> me<WG1691> shall<WG599> never<WG3756> die<WG599>. Believest thou<WG4100> this<WG165>?

She saith<WG3004> unto him<WG846>, Yea<WG3483>, Lord<WG2962>: I<WG1473> have believed<WG4100> that<WG3754> thou<WG4771> art<WG1488> the Christ<WG5547>, the Son<WG5207> of God<WG2316>, even he that cometh<WG2064> into<WG1519> the world<WG2889>.

And <WG2532> when she had<WG2036> said<WG2036> this<WG5023>, she went away<WG565>, and<WG2532> called<WG5455> Mary<WG3137> her<WG846> sister<WG79> secretly<WG2977>, saying<WG2036>, The Teacher<WG1320> is here<WG3918>, and<WG2532> calleth<WG5455> thee<WG4571>.
And she<WG5613>, when she<WG1565> heard<WG191> it<WG1453>, arose quickly<WG5035>, and<WG2532> went<WG2064> unto<WG4314> him<WG846>.

(Now <WG1161> Jesus<WG2424> was<WG2064> not yet<WG3768> come<WG2064> into<WG1519> the village<WG2968>, but<WG235> was<WG2258> still in<WG1722> the place<WG5117> where<WG3699> Martha<WG3136> met<WG5221> him<WG846>.)

The Jews<WG2453> then<WG3767> who were<WG5607> with<WG3326> her<WG846> in<WG1722> the house<WG3614>, and<WG2532> were<WG5607> consoling<WG3888> her<WG846>, when they saw<WG1492> Mary<WG3137>, that<WG3754> she rose up<WG450> quickly and<WG2532> went out<WG1831>, followed<WG190> her<WG846>, supposing<WG3004> that she was going<WG5217> unto<WG1519> the tomb<WG3419> to<WG2443> weep<WG2799> there<WG3754>.

Mary <WG3137> therefore<WG3767>, when<WG5613> she came<WG2064> where<WG3699> Jesus<WG2424> was<WG2258>, and saw<WG1492> him<WG846>, fell down<WG4098> at<WG1519> his<WG846> feet<WG4228>, saying<WG3004> unto him<WG846>, Lord<WG2962>, if<WG1487> thou hadst been<WG2258> here<WG5602>, my<WG3450> brother<WG80> had<WG599> not<WG3756> died<WG302>.

When <WG5613> Jesus<WG2424> therefore<WG3767> saw<WG1492> her<WG846> weeping<WG2799>, and<WG2532> the Jews<WG2453> also<WG4905> weeping<WG2799> who came<WG4905> with her<WG846>, he<WG1438> groaned<WG1690> in the spirit<WG4151>, and<WG2532> was troubled<WG5015>,
and <WG2532> said<WG2036>, Where<WG4226> have ye laid<WG5087> him<WG846>? They say<WG3004> unto him<WG846>, Lord<WG2962>, come<WG2064> and<WG2532> see<WG1492>.
Jesus <WG2424> wept<WG1145>.
The Jews<WG2453> therefore<WG3767> said<WG3004>, Behold<WG1492> how<WG4459> he loved<WG5368> him<WG846>!

But <WG1161> some<WG5100> of<WG1537> them<WG846> said<WG2036>, Could<WG1410> not<WG3756> this man<WG3778>, who opened<WG455> the eyes<WG3788> of him that<WG2443> was blind<WG5185>, have caused<WG4160> that<WG2443> this man<WG3778> also should<WG599> not<WG3361> die<WG599>?

Jesus <WG2424> therefore<WG3767> again<WG3825> groaning<WG1690> in<WG1722> himself<WG1438> cometh<WG2064> to<WG1519> the tomb<WG3419>. Now it was<WG2258> a cave<WG4693>, and<WG2532> a stone<WG3037> lay<WG1945> against<WG1909> it<WG1161>.

Jesus <WG2424> saith<WG3004>, Take ye away<WG142> the stone<WG3037>. Martha<WG3136>, the sister<WG79> of him that was dead<WG2348>, saith<WG3004> unto him<WG846>, Lord<WG2962>, by this time<WG2235> the body decayeth<WG3605>; for<WG1063> he hath been<WG2076> dead four days<WG5066>.

Jesus <WG2424> saith<WG3004> unto her<WG846>, Said I<WG2036> not<WG3756> unto thee<WG4671>, that<WG3754>, if<WG1437> thou believedst<WG4100>, thou shouldest see<WG3700> the glory<WG1391> of God<WG2316>?

So <WG3767> they took away<WG142> the stone<WG3037>. And<WG2532> Jesus<WG2424> lifted<WG142> up<WG507> his eyes<WG3788>, and<WG1161> said<WG2036>, Father<WG3962>, I thank<WG2168> thee<WG4671> that<WG3754> thou heardest<WG191> me<WG3450>.

And <WG1161> I<WG1473> knew<WG1492> that<WG3754> thou hearest<WG191> me<WG3450> always<WG3842>: but<WG235> because of<WG1223> the multitude<WG3793> that standeth around<WG4026> I said<WG2036> it<WG2443>, that they may believe<WG4100> that<WG3754> thou<WG4771> didst send<WG649> me<WG3165>.
And <WG2532> when he<WG2036> had thus<WG5023> spoken<WG2036>, he cried<WG2905> with a<WG5456> loud<WG3173> voice<WG5456>, Lazarus<WG2976>, come<WG1204> forth<WG1854>.

He <WG2532> that was dead<WG2348> came forth<WG1831>, bound<WG1210> hand<WG5495> and<WG2532> foot<WG4228> with<WG1210> grave-clothes<WG2750>; and<WG2532> his<WG846> face<WG3799> was bound about with<WG4019> a napkin<WG4676>. Jesus<WG2424> saith<WG3004> unto them<WG846>, Loose<WG3089> him<WG846>, and<WG2532> let him<WG863> go<WG5217>.

Many <WG4183> therefore<WG3767> of<WG1537> the Jews<WG2453>, who came<WG2064> to<WG4314> Mary<WG3137> and<WG2532> beheld<WG2300> that which<WG3739> he<WG2424> did<WG4160>, believed<WG4100> on<WG1519> him<WG846>.
But <WG1161> some<WG5100> of<WG1537> them<WG846> went away<WG565> to<WG4314> the Pharisees<WG5330>, and<WG2532> told<WG2036> them<WG846> the things<WG3739> which Jesus<WG2424> had done<WG4160>.

The chief priests<WG749> therefore<WG3767> and<WG2532> the Pharisees<WG5330> gathered<WG4863> a council<WG4892>, and<WG2532> said<WG3004>, What<WG5101> do we<WG4160>? for<WG3754> this<WG3778> man<WG444> doeth<WG4160> many<WG4183> signs<WG4592>.

If <WG1437> we let<WG863> him<WG846> thus alone<WG3779>, all<WG3956> men will believe<WG4100> on<WG1519> him<WG846>: and<WG2532> the Romans<WG4514> will come<WG2064> and<WG2532> take away<WG142> both<WG2532> our<WG2257> place<WG5117> and<WG2532> our nation<WG1484>.

But <WG1161> a certain one<WG1520> of<WG1537> them<WG846>, Caiaphas<WG2533>, being<WG5607> high priest<WG749> that<WG1565> year<WG1763>, said<WG2036> unto them<WG846>, Ye<WG5210> know<WG1492> nothing<WG3756> at all<WG5100>,

nor <WG3761> do ye take account<WG1260> that<WG3754> it is expedient<WG4851> for you<WG2254> that<WG2443> one<WG1520> man<WG444> should die<WG599> for<WG5228> the people<WG2992>, and<WG2532> that<WG2443> the whole<WG3650> nation<WG1484> perish<WG622> not<WG3361>.

Now <WG1161> this<WG5124> he<WG2036> said not<WG3756> of<WG575> himself<WG1438>: but<WG235>, being<WG5607> high priest<WG749> that<WG1565> year<WG1763>, he prophesied<WG4395> that<WG3754> Jesus<WG2424> should<WG3195> die<WG599> for<WG5228> the nation<WG1484>;

and <WG2532> not<WG3756> for<WG5228> the nation<WG1484> only<WG3440>, but<WG235> that<WG2443> he might also<WG2532> gather together<WG4863> into<WG1519> one<WG1520> the children<WG5043> of God<WG2316> that are scattered abroad<WG1287>.
So <WG3767> from<WG575> that<WG1565> day<WG2250> forth<WG575> they took counsel<WG4823> that<WG2443> they might put<WG615> him<WG846> to death<WG615>.

Jesus <WG2424> therefore<WG3767> walked<WG4043> no<WG3756> more<WG2089> openly<WG3954> among<WG1722> the Jews<WG2453>, but<WG235> departed<WG565> thence<WG1564> into<WG1519> the country<WG5561> near to<WG1451> the wilderness<WG2048>, into<WG1519> a city<WG4172> called<WG3004> Ephraim<WG2187>; and there<WG2546> he tarried<WG1304> with<WG3326> the<WG846> disciples<WG3101>.

Now <WG1161> the passover<WG3957> of the Jews<WG2453> was<WG2258> at hand<WG1451>: and<WG2532> many<WG4183> went<WG305> up to<WG1519> Jerusalem<WG2414> out of<WG1537> the country<WG5561> before<WG4253> the passover<WG3957>, to<WG2443> purify<WG48> themselves<WG1438>.

They <WG2212> sought therefore<WG3767> for Jesus<WG2424>, and<WG2532> spake<WG3004> one with<WG3326> another<WG240>, as they stood<WG2476> in<WG1722> the temple<WG2411>, What<WG5101> think<WG1380> ye<WG5213>? That<WG3754> he will<WG2064> not<WG3756> come<WG2064> to<WG1519> the feast<WG3361>?

Now <WG1161> the<WG2532> chief priests<WG749> and<WG2532> the Pharisees<WG5330> had given<WG1325> commandment<WG1785>, that<WG2443>, if<WG1437> any man<WG5100> knew<WG1097> where<WG4226> he was<WG4226>, he should show<WG3377> it<WG3704>, that they might take<WG4084> him<WG846>.
